content: @Jose Costa Teixeira has an IHE template that I have working locally. What are the steps we need to do to get this template available on the build server? @Lloyd McKenzie @Grahame Grieve
Jose and I are the IHE authorities on this template. It likely will change, so we need to know how to manage it.
Technically, we just need to add it as a trusted template. @Grahame Grieve will have to identify what the policy requirements are for us to trust it both now and into the future
Oops, I had not sent the email to Grahame requesting this. Just did so now
@Grahame Grieve I intend to show some of the IG building capability at the IHE meeting next week. Will the IHE template be in place?

@Jose Costa Teixeira can you outline the things that you have changed from the HL7 template? I think we need this for discussions with IHE leadership for acceptance of this template, and I think it is useful for tracking overall anyway. Yes, I know github tracks details, looking more for executive summary of the delta.
what does "the IHE template be in place" - is anything there dependent on me?
for the build machine
I have Jose's template on my local machine... looks okay enough.. but I want it to show up on the build machine
oh - the ci-build. I'll do that tonight.
thanks
I think Jose's IHE template is on this GitHub https://github.com/IHE/ihe-ig-template
I changed the colors and logo.

This is just a minor change, this is not at all the template I have in mind. IHE should not decide for this template, IHE should decide whether we want to work on a template at all. Then we can have requirements and a change log.
anyway, this is indeed the repository with the changes
@Grahame Grieve my idea is that this should be the official IHE template, we start with what we have and we build from there. It will always be in the same repository.
excellent. Yes IHE needs to have a look-and-feel. It might be just a change of color and icon.
The layout of sections and such is a different effort. Right? I expect we will coordinate that with Lloyds sample IG...
Yes it is different thing (it is in the IG itself). And yes, this is taken from (occasionally contributing to, if needed) Lloyd's IG
added next release
Thanks, i'll let the group know.
How can we make it so that this template is automatically downloaded by the IG publisher?
(assuming that is what should happen)
you shouldn't need to do anything beyond setting up the template to to build bu the ci-build itself
how? By putting the CI build hook to the template itself?
yes
